ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned vector geometry, scalar and vector functions, partial derivatives, double and triple integrals, how to parameterize both curves and surfaces, and the other renditions of the fundamental theorem of calculus such as Green's theorem, Stoke's and the Fundamental Theorem of Line Integrals. Basically calculus that you can do with 3D solids/surfaces.
A variety of concepts in multivariable calculus
Learned core multi concepts and their applications, strengthened calculus intuition and skills
I learned different techniques to find the surface area and volume of 3D objects.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: Well-organized, the p-sets were fair and not too bad, pre-class videos were helpful. The exams were also fair, and there are practice exams, solutions, and review sessions to prepare you.

Improvements: I feel like we rushed a bit in the end of the semester when going over Divergence theorem, so maybe spend a bit more time clarifying how all these calculus theorems are tied together.
While the material of the course was quite challenging at times, I felt the course was very well structured with many resources available to students.
Challenging content is stimulating, but the structure of the course is quite unforgiving.
This course has very difficult content that would be aided by in person learning.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Succeeded: The online format with Canvas was fine. Everything was organized and there was no problem accessing or submitting any course materials.

Improved: I think a lot of us didn't use Ximera a lot, even though it was probably a helpful resource during the course. Maybe in the modules for each day or for each midterm put supplementary Ximera problems that students could do.
The recorded videos were very helpful.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Honestly it's not as bad as people make it out to be, take the spring class if you want more one-on-one work with your professor or classmates, since less people will take it. I would recommend it if you are required to fulfill this for pre-med or a major.
If you like math, youll probably enjoy this course to some degree.
I would recommend this course if it was required but thats about it.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We used the textbook and watched recorded videos to help with lecture content.
